p: Diabetes mellitus (DM), more simply called diabetes, is an endocrine disorder caused by a defect in the pancreas that prevents the production of insulin or its inefficient use by the body, resulting in hyperglycemia that, over time, leads to severe health complications ( American Diabetes Association, 2009; Toelsie et al., 2013). DM is a worldwide growing epidemic disorder, with 424.9 million people affected in 2017 and an estimated 48% increase in the number of diabetic individuals by the year 2045 ( European Society of Cardiology, 2019).
